translation.en: ♪ Countdown till we blast open the top ♪
♪ When all the days felt black and white ♪
♪ Those were the best shades of my life ♪
♪ And even if we hit the ground ♪
♪ Keep dreaming like we'll live forever ♪
♪ But live it like it's now or never ♪
♪ 'Cause we got all we need today ♪
♪ That's been running through our veins ♪
♪ That's been singing in the rain ♪
♪ 'Cause we're still rising up right now ♪
translation.ko: 아직 오르는 중이니까 이제 정상을 향해

translation.en: ♪ And even if we hit the ground ♪
♪ Keep dreaming like we'll live forever ♪
♪ But live it like it's now or never ♪
Too bad we wasted the tightest we've played on sound check!
Wait until tonight, man, when this place gets packed with record execs.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤을 위해 아껴놔 공연장이 음반사 임원들로 미어터질 테니까

translation.en: Oh no. I was just warming up. You guys were the ones on fire.
translation.ko: 나야 몸 푸는 수준이었고 너희야말로 장난 아니더라

translation.en: Could you just own your awesomeness for once?
translation.ko: 한 번이라도 잘난 거 인정하면 어디 덧나?

translation.en: OK, well, I'm thinking we fuel up before the show. I'm thinking street dogs.
translation.ko: 공연 전에 배나 채울까나? 핫도그 어때?

translation.en: Vegetarian. I could never hurt an animal.
I see a lot of bands.
Been in a couple myself. I was really feeling it.
translation.ko: 두어 번 직접 한 적도 있고 근데 이번엔 정말 짜릿했어

translation.en: That's what we do this for. I'm Luke, by the way.
translation.ko: 그래서 밴드를 하는 거죠 난 루크라고 해요

translation.en: I'll make sure not to wipe the tables down with this one.
Oh, good call. Whenever they get wet, they just kinda fall apart in your hands.
translation.ko: 잘 생각했어요 젖으면 천이 손에서 자꾸만 미끄러지더라고요

translation.en: Don't you guys have to go get hot dogs?
Yeah, he had a hamburger for lunch.
translation.ko: 갈 거야 얘 점심때 햄버거 먹었대요

translation.en: It's what that girl said in there tonight.
About our music, all right? It's like an energy.
translation.ko: 우리 음악 얘기 우린 음악이란 에너지로 관객과 이어지는 거야
우린 음악이란 에너지로 관객과 이어지는 거야

translation.en: They can feel us when we play.
I want that connection with everybody.
translation.ko: 세상 모두와 그런 교감을 나누고 싶어

translation.en: Then we're gonna need more T-shirts.
-[girl 2] Oh my God. Reggie! -[girl 1] Oh my God! Hi, it's me!
Man... I can't wait until we eat someplace
translation.ko: 있잖냐 언제쯤 제대로 된 데서 먹을 수 있을까

translation.en: where the condiments aren't served out of the back of an Oldsmobile.
translation.ko: 차 트렁크에서 소스 안 뿌려도 되는 곳

translation.en: Sorry, I got some pickle juice on your battery cables.
translation.ko: 죄송한데 배터리 케이블에 피클 주스를 흘렸어요

translation.en: No problem. It'll help with the rust.
translation.ko: 괜찮다, 녹슨 거 빠지고 좋지 뭐

translation.en: I can't even count how many bands have played here
translation.ko: 셀 수 없이 많은 밴드가 그 무대에서 연주하고

translation.en: and then ended up being huge.
Chill, man. Street dogs haven't killed us yet.
translation.ko: 그냥 먹어 설마 먹고 죽기야 하겠냐?

translation.en: OK, I know you don't want me to ask, but have you figured out
translation.ko: 질색할 거 알지만 물어볼게 이따 어떻게 할지 생각했어?

translation.en: -what you're gonna do today? -I'll know in the moment.
translation.ko: 이따 어떻게 할지 생각했어? 때가 되면 알겠지

translation.en: Mrs. Harrison said this is your last chance.
Ugh! What is she handing out?
Here you go. My group's performing at the spirit rally tomorrow.
translation.ko: 받아 우리 그룹이 내일 애교심 집회에서 공연하거든

translation.en: I'm sure you guys have nothing better to do.
translation.ko: 어차피 그때 달리 할 일도 없지?

translation.en: Oh my gosh, Flynn. Don't bother coming!
translation.ko: 어쩜, 플린, 굳이 안 와도 돼
내일 더티 캔디 꼭 보러 와!

translation.en: You know they're gonna get married and have a bunch of unholy babies.
translation.ko: 저 둘이 결혼해서 사악한 애들 줄줄이 낳을 텐데?

translation.en: You'd actually have to talk to him to know that.
translation.ko: 말 한마디 못 해보고 어떻게 안대?

translation.en: And only one of them has to be a demon to make a demon baby.
translation.ko: 그리고 부모 중 한쪽만 악마여도 악마가 나오는 법이야

translation.en: Now, let's go prove everybody wrong.
translation.ko: 가서 다들 틀렸단 걸 증명해 주자

translation.en: Almost as impressive as your game against Glendale.
OK, we have one last performance.
I was about to go watch your brother's game.
translation.ko: 네 동생 경기 보러 가는 길이야

translation.en: I've had photo shoots all day. Didn't even get a chance to eat.
translation.ko: 종일 촬영 때문에 바빴다 밥도 못 먹고 일했지

translation.en: I got a phone call today.
-Well, it was my Realtor friend. -Oh, that.
translation.ko: 부동산 하는 아빠 친구 있잖아 아, 그 얘기?

translation.en: Yeah, and she says if we are serious about selling the house,
translation.ko: 그 친구 말이 진짜로 집을 팔 생각이면

translation.en: then she wants me to take some pictures for the website.
Which means we have to do a lot of cleaning
and get rid of some stuff.
You know, your brother and I wouldn't even know where to begin.
translation.ko: 네 동생하고 난 어디부터 손대야 할지도 몰라

translation.en: It's OK, honey. If you're not ready, I--
Oh, and don't forget the loft.
You know, those old instruments that were there when we moved in?
translation.ko: 이사 왔을 때 거기에 오래된 악기가 잔뜩 있었잖아

translation.en: Oh God. I'm gonna be late.
How did we get back here?
Whoa! Slow down. You look like you've seen a ghost.
Why aren't you answering me? [exhales sharply]
Just wanted to make sure you were OK.
You don't believe me, do you?
Honey, of course I do. Mija, I see your mom all the time.
translation.ko: 당연히 믿지 우리 딸, 나도 늘 엄마가 보인단다

translation.en: I know. It's different for all of us.
Dad, you're not listening to me.
Tell me what you saw. It's just you and me here.
translation.ko: 대체 뭘 봤냐? 우리뿐이니 편하게 말해

translation.en: [sighs] You sound just like Dr. Turner.
Well, maybe seeing Dr. Turner again isn't such a bad idea.
translation.ko: 터너 박사님을 다시 만나보는 것도 괜찮지

translation.en: I know I saw something. I'm not crazy.
translation.ko: 분명히 봤다고 나 맛 간 거 아니야

translation.en: Well, we're all a little crazy.
Oh my God! Please stop screaming!
Who are you, and what are you doing in my mom's studio?
translation.ko: 너희 다 뭐야? 우리 엄마 작업실에서 뭐 해?

translation.en: Your mom's studio? This is our studio. Trust me, my...
translation.ko: 너희 엄마 작업실? 여기 우리 작업실이야, 진짜야

translation.en: The grand piano is new, and... and... and ...
That is definitely not my six-string.
Can you give me just one second?
Just... give me a second. Thank you.
Guys, what is going on? How did she get her stuff in here so fast?
translation.ko: 얘들아, 이게 가능해? 순식간에 자기 물건을 쫙 깔아놨잖아

translation.en: Maybe... maybe she's a witch. There's chairs floating on the ceiling.
translation.ko: 마녀일지도 몰라 의자가 막 공중에 떠 있잖아

translation.en: OK, there is no such thing as witches.
You sure? I used to think there was no such thing as ghosts.
translation.ko: 확실해? 난 세상엔 유령도 없는 줄 알았거든?

translation.en: OK, so we're going with witch?
No! We are not going with witch.
She's not a witch. OK, look. She's just scared.
translation.ko: 마녀일 리 없어 봐, 쟤도 쫄았잖아

translation.en: with a softer touch handle this.
Why are you in our studio?
Oh my gosh! How did you do that?
Clearly, you're not understanding... She doesn't get it.
translation.ko: 말귀를 못 알아듣네 얘랑은 말이 안 통한다

translation.en: OK, look. We're ghosts, all right?
We're just three ghosts, and we're really happy to be home.
translation.ko: 셋 다 유령인데 집에 와서 너무 기쁘거든?

translation.en: So, thank you for the flowers. They really brighten up the room.
translation.ko: 꽃 장식 고맙다 덕분에 분위기가 확 폈네

translation.en: -We're in a band called Sunset Curve. -Tell your friends.
translation.ko: - 우린 선셋 커브란 밴드야 - 친구들한테 소문내 줘

translation.en: Last night was supposed to be a really big night for us.
It was gonna change our lives.
I'm, uh... I'm pretty sure it did.
This is freaking me out. [breathes sharply, grunts]
-What is that? What are you doing? -It's my phone.
No! Stop talking to them. They aren't real.
translation.ko: 아니다, 무시해야지 진짜 존재하는 것도 아닌데

translation.en: -There's no such thing as cute ghosts. -Oh, think we're cute?
translation.ko: 꽃미남 유령이라니 말이 돼? 우리가 꽃미남이야?

translation.en: What? No. No, no, no. Th-Th-That's impossible.
After we floated out of the ambulance,
all we did was go to that weird, dark room where Alex cried.
translation.ko: 깜깜한 방에 있던 게 다인데? 앨릭스가 울던 곳

translation.en: I think we were all pretty upset. OK.
But that was just for like an hour.
Look. I'm just telling you what my phone says.
translation.ko: 난 폰에서 본 대로 말한 거야

translation.en: Wait. So... So, it has been 25 years.
I have been crying for 25 years? How is that possible?
translation.ko: 내가 무려 25년 동안 통곡했다고? - 말이 돼? - 네가 감정이 좀 격하잖아

translation.en: -Well, you're a very emotional person. -I am not!
translation.ko: - 말이 돼? - 네가 감정이 좀 격하잖아 아니거든?

translation.en: [boy] Thought you were afraid to come out here.
translation.ko: 무서워서 여긴 못 올 줄 알았는데?

translation.en: You talking to your ghost friend? How does he look? Is he hideous?
translation.ko: 유령 친구랑 얘기 중? 어떻게 생겼어? 오싹해?
- 네가 보이나 봐 - 아니, 못 봐

translation.en: Stop being weird and come eat.
Look, I'm very sorry for what happened to you guys,
translation.ko: 그런 일 당한 건 나도 참 안타까운데

translation.en: but this isn't your studio anymore.
Did you miss the part where she kicked us out, or...
translation.ko: 방금 우리더러 나가라고 한 거 못 들었냐?

translation.en: Thank you for our leftovers and the power of the mighty microwave.
translation.ko: 남은 음식과 전능한 전자레인지를 주셔서 감사합니다

translation.en: Carlos tells me he found you in the studio.
She was out there talking to herself.
I was rehearsing for a play.
I brought you my pasteles and arroz con pollo.
translation.ko: 직접 만든 파스텔레하고 닭고기 아로스 가져왔어

translation.en: I can't let you have leftovers every night.
translation.ko: 맨날 남은 것만 먹게 둘 순 없지

translation.en: My sister would kill me, may she rest in peace.
translation.ko: 너희 엄마가 알면 난리 날 거다 부디 천국에 잘 있길

translation.en: Oh... I see things here are going better?
...Julie has been cleaning out mom's studio.
translation.ko: 줄리가 자기 엄마 작업실을 정리하고 있어

translation.en: Hopefully, we can get the house on the market and some offers soon.
translation.ko: 부동산에 집 내놓고 조만간 살 사람이 나서길 바라야지

translation.en: Well, I like the sound of that.
Moving from here is only gonna help you move on.
translation.ko: 이 집에서 나가야만 새로 시작할 수 있어

translation.en: You've got to rip that Band-Aid off and get the pain over with.
[chuckles awkwardly] That's me. Ripping off the Band-Aid.
translation.ko: 나한테 한 말이야 반창고는 그만 됐다고

translation.en: Hey, Julie, I really like what you guys did with the place.
Oh, I'm just here to help, mija.
Oh... I think that's our cue to leave.
I mean, you should be at Pilates.
translation.ko: 그게 아니라 이모 필라테스 갈 시간이잖아
- 미리 연락할 걸 그랬어 - 별말을 다

translation.en: And now that you're no longer in the music program,
you can concentrate on classes that matter.
You got the e-mail from the school, right?
wanna hear how I slid into home and was almost safe?
translation.ko: 내가 홈으로 슬라이딩했는데 거의 세이프였던 거 알아?

translation.en: You're a good brother. That's not gonna work.
Why didn't you tell me? You made me lie to your aunt.
translation.ko: 왜 말 안 했니? 이모한테 거짓말했잖아

translation.en: Sorry. I was gonna tell you after dinner.
I know those classes can be difficult,
translation.ko: 아직은 음악 수업이 무리란 거 안다

translation.en: but you still like music, don't you?
Look, we talked about this, you know? And how painful memories can be, but...
translation.ko: 전에도 얘기했잖니 추억 때문에 많이 힘들겠지

translation.en: You know, every time I see you and Carlos, I see Mom.
translation.ko: 아빠도 너랑 카를로스를 볼 때마다 엄마가 보인단다

translation.en: It's like she's right here with us.
But you know what? I love that. I do.
And maybe if you'd give yourself a chance,
I must have left the stereo on in the garage.
The whole neighborhood could hear you. I thought I told you to leave.
translation.ko: 온 동네가 다 듣겠네 여기서 나가라고 했잖아

translation.en: Wait. People can hear us play?
Yes! And so did my dad and my brother!
W-W-Wait. Wait. So, only you can see us,
-I mean, what kind of ghosts are we? -Who cares, man? People can hear us play!
translation.ko: 무슨 유령이 이렇지? 알 게 뭐야 우리 연주가 들린다잖아!

translation.en: We might be dead, but our music isn't.
translation.ko: 우린 죽었어도 우리 음악은 살아있단 거지

translation.en: Yeah, I'm fine. I just had to turn off the CD player.
Wait. Is this the junk that was in the loft?
translation.ko: 이 고물들이 다 다락에서 나온 거냐?

translation.en: Some of this stuff's in pretty good shape.
Hey, maybe we can make a couple bucks.
What? Yo, stop touching my drums. Tell him to stop touching my drums.
translation.ko: 뭐요? 내 드럼 건들지 마요 드럼에서 손 떼라고 해!

translation.en: I liked that song you had on.

translation.ko: - 오예, 선셋 커브랍니다 - 주변에 소문 좀 내줘요

translation.en: It's just an old CD I found.
Well, still, it's nice that you're listening to music again.
translation.ko: 어쨌든 다시 음악 듣는 거 보니 마음이 놓인다

translation.en: Out here you can play whatever you want, whenever you want.
Oh no, no, no, no. Not you. I mean... Uh... Er...
You know, give me a minute.
We'll figure out this music program thing.
translation.ko: 음악 프로그램 문제는 같이 고민해 보자

translation.en: -He likes our song. -Oh yeah. He doesn't count.
translation.ko: - 우리 노래가 맘에 드신대 - 영양가 없어

translation.en: Why can't you guys just be normal ghosts?
Hang out at an old mansion. I hear Pasadena's nice.
I think she's warming up to us.
Yeah, I've always wanted to go to Pasadena.
I know this is all completely insane, but you do know how rad this is?
translation.ko: 어이없는 상황이긴 한데 그래도 진짜 환상이지 않냐?

translation.en: People... Actual people can hear us play.
translation.ko: 사람들, 살아있는 사람들이 우리 연주를 듣는 거잖아

translation.en: Yeah, it's just I've just had a really, really awful day.
translation.ko: 그래, 근데 내가 오늘 끔찍하게 피곤했거든?

translation.en: -I gotta go. -Well, I'm sorry you had a bad day,
but three guys just found out that they had a bad 25 years,
translation.ko: 우린 방금 25년이 끔찍하게 지나간 걸 알았어

translation.en: and then they found out that the one thing they lived for
translation.ko: 그러다 우리가 살면서 제일 하고 싶던 단 하나를

translation.en: in the first place they can still do.
translation.ko: 그러다 우리가 살면서 제일 하고 싶던 단 하나를 다시 할 수 있단 걸 알았지

translation.en: Look, I'm sorry we came into your life,
what I just felt in there actually made me feel alive again.
translation.ko: 저기서 연주하고 나니 다시 살아난 기분이야
우리 셋 다 되살아난 것 같았지

translation.en: So, you can kick us out if you want, but we're not giving up music.
translation.ko: 우리를 쫓아내는 건 네 마음이지만 음악은 포기 못 해

translation.en: That's a gift no musician would ever turn down.
Clearly, your mom is into music.
You guys haven't seen her anywhere, have you?
translation.ko: 혹시 우리 엄마 본 적 있어?

translation.en: No. No, I mean, you're kind of the first person we've seen.
Yeah, but she's not dead, so it doesn't answer her question.
translation.ko: 쟤는 죽은 게 아니잖아 그걸 물은 게 아니라고

translation.en: Yeah. I think she knows what we mean.

translation.ko: 엄마 일은 정말 할 말이 없다

translation.en: Y-Y-You know that's like 25 years of rust just getting dusted off.
translation.ko: 아까는 25년간 녹슨 데서 먼지만 살짝 털어낸 거야

translation.en: -Yeah. Do you play the piano too? -[Julie] No.
No, I don't play. That was my mom's stuff in there.
translation.ko: 난 못 쳐 저것들은 다 엄마 거야

translation.en: No way. She's an amazing songwriter.
translation.ko: 이런, 너희 엄마 정말 뛰어난 작곡가였구나

translation.en: There's a song on the piano. If it's hers...
translation.ko: 피아노 위에 악보가 있더라고 너희 엄마 곡이라면

translation.en: if you need a place to stay,
There's a bathroom in the back
and a couch that turns into a bed if you still use any of that stuff.
translation.ko: 소파는 침대로 바꿀 수 있어 유령도 자는진 모르겠다만

translation.en: I just really like showers and sometimes the occasional bath.
translation.ko: 샤워가 취미거든 가끔 욕조에서 목욕도 하고

translation.en: [Julie] "What would you say if I told you
there are three ghosts living in my mom's studio?"
Hey, I know being dead isn't our first choice,
but, I mean, it sure is easy getting around.
I lost my shirt on that one.
Ooh, never mind! There it is.
Just another painful reminder of where we never got to play.
translation.ko: 결국 공연 못 한 아픈 기억만 떠오르잖아

translation.en: -Thanks, Luke. -I mean, boys, the game isn't over yet.
translation.ko: - 참 고맙다, 루크 - 게임은 아직 안 끝났어

translation.en: I'm telling you, we've been given a second chance.
Let's see how many clubs we can hit before sunrise.
translation.ko: 해 뜨기 전까지 되는 대로 클럽에 다녀보자고

translation.en: ♪ Life's a test, yes But you go toe-to-toe ♪
♪ You don't give up, no You grow ♪
translation.ko: 그래도 포기하면 안 돼 나아질 테니까

translation.en: ♪ Though I wish I could hold you through it ♪
♪ I know it's not the same ♪
♪ And I just want you to do it ♪
♪ So get up, get out Relight that spark ♪
♪ You know the rest by heart ♪
♪ Wake up, wake up If it's all you do ♪
♪ Look out, look inside of you ♪
♪ It's what you'll gain Raising your voice to the rain ♪
